meanings.definition: To plant vegetation on (an area) again.
meanings.sent1: We will revegetate the park with new trees and flowers.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalists decided to revegetate the barren land to bring back wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The gardener joked that he would revegetate the garden with magic beans.
meanings.sent4: The community worked together to revegetate the neighborhood, turning it into a green oasis.
meanings.sent5: After the fire, the volunteers came together to revegetate the forest, making it lush once more.

meanings.sent1: The conservationists aim to revegetate the desert to support the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often revegetate their fields to improve soil quality.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's experiment accidentally caused the lab to revegetate with mold.
meanings.sent4: The old garden was like a blank canvas waiting to be revegetated with colorful plants.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped to naturally revegetate the hillsides, bringing back greenery to the landscape.
